sentences.en: Britain's customary stoicism had been overwhelmed by raw, unbridled grief.
sentences.cn: 大不列颠那惯有的沉着冷静被一种原始, 已经失去的悲痛所淹没.

sentences.en: He appeared to face life's setbacks with stoicism.
sentences.cn: 他看来很能以容忍态度面对人生的挫折.

sentences.en: His apathetic stoicism amazed the bandits.
sentences.cn: 他们觉得犯不上把这种绝望的人杀掉.

sentences.en: Manager Arsene Wenger has restored the defensive stoicism that characterised Arsenal sides of the past.
sentences.cn: 温格让阿森纳重拾招牌式的坚固防守.

sentences.en: Mostly produced in the last two years of his life, Cicero’s philosophy comprises a mixture of scepticism in the theory of knowledge and stoicism in ethics.
sentences.cn: 西塞罗的创作绝大部分是在他生命的最后两年完成的，他的哲学包含了认识论上的怀疑主义和伦理学上斯多葛主义的混合。

sentences.en: Over the centuries this has produced a sort of stoicism.
sentences.cn: 几个世纪以来,这种经历产生了一种坚忍自制的精神.

sentences.en: She endured her long illness with stoicism.
sentences.cn: 她默默忍受长期的病痛。

sentences.en: Stoicism also taught a peace through detachment from worldly things.
sentences.cn: 斯多葛派也通过从世俗事物中分离来教导一种和平.

sentences.en: STOICISM: This shit is good for me.
sentences.cn: 斯多葛哲学派: 狗屎运对我有好处.

sentences.en: They bore their plight with stoicism and fortitude.
sentences.cn: 他们以坚忍刚毅的精神直面困境。

sentences.en: They reacted to the appalling weather with typical British stoicism.
sentences.cn: 他们忍受着恶劣天气的煎熬,表现了英国人典型的坚忍不拔的精神.

words.tran_cn: 坚忍的；禁欲的；斯多葛学派的

trans.tran_cn: 禁欲主义，坚忍，淡泊，(S-)斯多葛学派
